alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 11 at 3:20PM AKST until February 13 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST SUNDAY NIGHT FOR HOMER... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. West to southwest wind 15 to 30 mph with gusts as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Homer. * WHEN...From noon Sunday to midnight AKST Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect periods of light snow tonight through Sunday night. Southwest winds will rapidly strengthen between 9am and Noon on Sunday, then peak during the afternoon and early evening hours. With temperatures in the 20s, snow will easily be lofted and immediately result in low visibilities. Conditions will gradually improve late Sunday evening into the overnight hours as winds diminish.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
